No longer free - it now costs €4 per person, or €10 for a family ticket, which is still a bargain. Not massive, but definitely worth a visit
Zoo only just started charging for entry & only €10 for 2 adults & 2 children. Excellent & well worth a visit !

Highly recommend this little zoo. Entry fee very cheap. So many tropical birds and other small animals. Walking through this zoo feels like a stroll in a park. You can even go inside one of the Averys to get a closer look. Great for any age and so well kept.

Small, well organized rest park. Nice place to spend time with friends or family, especially with children. There are not a lot of animals to look at, but they are all groomed and look nice. My estimation is very good.

My son is a huge animal lover and he really enjoyed the zoo. It is small but not very expensive. The Arctic foxes had just had pups which were adorable! The area where you can walk in with the birds was also interesting. Most of the animals are in open areas instead of

My wife and I had a weekend in Lille and decided to visit the local Zoo, we where very glad we did there was some very interesting wildlife there it’s not to big so you can get around in just over an hour without rushing very nice for children to get a view of different types of

Nice zoo, not big, within one hour you can visit all animals, fee is 4e, very compact and well organized, plenty of animals in open enclosure. Zoo located in the ground of the military headquarter( located in the Fort), by the way Fort is close for public surround by park area.

Sitting beside the citadel, this small zoo is quite nice and really not expensive. A good value for a quick break, it was only 10euro for a family of three. The zoo is not huge but it still provides a nice experience for a few hours and the price is great.

Good little zoo. Felt a bit sorry for some of the birds and small animals as they looked like they just wanted to get out and they couldn't fly around much. Hippos were happy and playing which was nice to see.

Most of the zoo was being upgraded and needed a good clean up and some rejuvernation work done. The monkeys were swinging about but their environment could be better. There were plenty of birds on the little lake.

What a lovely experience! Clean, well kept and extremely good value for money (€10 for a family of 4). The enclosures are really lovely and the animals seem happy and lively. Staff are friendly and this nice little zoo is well worth a visit. We visited at lunchtime on a Sat and
Old town zoo with some small cages.in an excellent setting by citadel and only 4 euros.surprising variety of animals looked well cared for and enclosures very clean

Having read reviews before we visited, I wasn’t expecting to see many different species of animals but actually there are lots! Well worth the entrance fee and a nice size to walk around for an hour or two without getting bored/tired. Particularly enjoyed the meerkats, otters
We paid 4€ to spend at least 3 hours at the zoo, lots of animals to see. Great value for money, definitely worth a visit!

We passed this little zoo while viewing the citadel, and for 4€ entrance fee, thought - why not? It was a cute little zoo, great for kids. We spent about 1 hour here. The animal selection was not particularly original exempting a couple of majestic Brazilian maned wolves and a
Had lovely enclosures and went on a lovely day, they spoke a bit of English so helped us with tickets. However the zoo is much smaller than I thought but still a nice walk around
Nice place in the park of the city center Closed in the winter time Is free for all the people living in the Lille Metropole

Our family enjoyed this trip. 10/15 min walk from centre towards the park / citadel. Good range of animals and the zoo was in good shape and condition. Price was fair for size of zoo (would give 1-2hrs for time to go round). Recommended

The animals looked sad. For the first time, it made us reflect and wonder if zoos are necessities. First of all, many of the animals are from Asia, Africa etc, they are not made for the cold weather. Secondly, they looked so lonely. Just imagine ourselves being placed behind

Weekend away in Lille with my husband and realised that everything closes on a Sunday . Headed from our hotel to the zoo , which we had heard recommended by a waitress over dinner. It took us about 20mins to walk from our central hotel, nice and easy . €4 entry and you are in .

We visited this zoo by default. While walking in the citadel park we need the loo ! Not a public convenience anywhere so decided to pay 4 euros to get into the zoo loo (yes we were desperate). However our toilet stop lasted one and half hours the zoo was great. There is not a
Small zoo not far from the centre. Not many large animals but rhinos, monkeys.wolves , birds and reptiles. Only 4 euros entry price.

The zoo was closed for over a year but now re-opened. It is a must see for visitors to Lille. Two foxes (one white, one grey) were added and they are so cute! It used to be free but for overseas visitors there is now an entrance fee of €4, which is very reasonable.

I lived this zoo. It is small and can easily be done in an hour or two if you take your time and enjoy each area. I loved the “petting” area, where a sloth was right in front of me climbing on a bush. (No you can’t actually pet the animals but they are close and roaming
Free if you are leaving in Lille, this zoo is small but very nice. There were a super cute baby tapir but also rhinoceros and a red panda. Very nice place to go for an hour during the weekend.

Small zoo but very nice. Entrance fee is 4€, but definitely worth it. There are a lot of different animals, even in winter. We enjoyed it very much. We spent approximately 90 minutes here and had a very nice time.

Dad agrees. After 3 days+ at Disney Paris, Lille zoo is an oasis of calm. No pressure, no toy shop tat....just a superb informative walk looking at well kempt animals and birds. We spent an hour and a half there. Longer, but we had to catch Eurostar. Entry is surprisingly cheap.
When you are in Lille and with children, def. a must go place is the zoo. It is clean and entertaining for the whole family.

Just come back from here and was very impressed 4 euros to get in and a lovely little zoo with a wide range of animals. As an animal lover i am always wary of zoos but the animals seemed very content noce enclosures and well looked after. Couldn't have been happier will
The price of the ticket (4€) is fair considering the amount of animals there. In fact many where missing. Not the best zoo ever, but still ok for its price.

We had the chance to go there on a bright sunny day and could walk around and enjoy the sun. This is not the biggest zoo on earth but it is quite pleasant and the white rhinos are impressive. Nice to go there with kids if you get the chance, they will surely have a great time.
Just a small zoo but beautifully presented and not very expensive to go around. It would be ideal for taking children round as there are lots of smaller creatures and birds to see.

Very friendly staff, very warm welcome, frustrated that it was only open on Wednesday and the weekend in September as we where there Monday to Thursday, Small but clean but a little rustic zoo, animals well looked after..
Not a bad way to spend a little time. There is now a small charge for visitors that are not from Lille. Plenty to see, animals seemed to be kept OK.

A lovely, clean little zoo with a surprising array of animals, set within the ground of a large park (not dissimilar to London Zoo). Many of the animals seemed very happy which isnt always the case, particularly the monkeys who enjoy a fantastic enclosure. Lille Zoo is a must
A small, cosy, relaxing stay at the local zoo in the park. Used to be free, now costs a small entrance fee. Well worth the € 4 for an impressive collection of animals.

The zoo is approximately a 5-10minute walk away from the old town. It has a wide selection of animals which are extremely well looked after and their environments mirror their natural habitats. Entrance fee was 4 euros per person which is an absolutely fantastic price for what
This is a well laid out, clean zoo with well kept animals. It's not the biggest but there is plenty to see here & we easily spent 3 hours watching the animals & wondering round the park land.

We visited the zoo and spent a pleasant few hours looking at the animals. Our favourite was the giant tortoise feeding. It cost just €10 for a family of 4 and an extra €4 each for grandparents. The zoo was very clean and ideal for half a day strolling round. From Lille we caught

This is a small zoo located next to the citadel park. We spend about an hour here, but with an entrance fee of €4 it was worth it. The zoo holds small to medium sized animals. Highlights being white rhinoceroses and red pandas. Bring your own water and food, because there are

We are used to very expensive zoos in SE England, where an adult ticket can easily set you back £15-20, so this little zoo at just 4 Euro each was a bargain. The animals seemed happy in their habitats and well cared for. The red pandas were a particular highlight for us. It is
Lovely afternoon with my son at this well presented zoo. Very reasonable entry, particularly loved the sloth and red pandas. Well worth a visit.

We came here on our last day in Lille (the only sunny day!). It cost us 4 euros each which is a really good price for a zoo. We thought the areas the animals were in were really spacious and lovely. They all had indoor areas which meant they had somewhere to shelter if it

Lille Zoo is easy to get to using L1, 12 or L90 bus from Palais des Beaux Arts. A family ticket for 4 to get into the zoo costs 10€. Apparently two years ago the zoo was very mediocre so they shut and transformed- and what a transformation. It is not a large zoo, nor does it
Not the biggest or best zoo we've ever visited but a very nice way to spend an hour or two on an afternoon in Lille

It's been improved and there is now a modest charge of 4 euros per person (free for children under five). Certainly, you won't get the range of species in bigger zoos but it's actually excellent value for money. The new (at least I think it's new) tropical section was great

We had a good look around and it took 1hr 30 min at a relaxed walk. It was only €11.50 for all 5 of us to get in. We enjoyed a good variety of animals and my partner loved the red panda.. There are Rhino and lots reptiles to see

We visited this zoo whilst in France for the zoo it did take us a while to find it but had a lovely surprise when we eventually did. It cost just 10 euros for 2 adults and a child which is very cheap. Plenty of toilets all the way round and a good selection of animals. Would

At 8 euros for two adults and an under 5 this was great value for money with plenty of animals and reptiles to see. The food available outside the zoo is reasonable and very fairly priced. Would definitely visit again.

Very busy and deceptive in size little zoo. From reading some of the less positive reviews on here it is clear that many changes have been made to improve the enclosures of most of the animals. The parrots though need much more space but hopefully that is coming. Small but

Superbly maintained smallish zoo with happy animals and great enclosures. Planned in a walk around a route one way it was very interesting, half of the animals I had never heard of. Fascinating for all ages
It's a small zoo. Don't expect to see many animals. Nevertheless, you can visit especially if you have kids. The park around the zoo is very nice and relaxing.
We spent about 2 hours in this well maintained, nicely landscaped zoo. Of course this is not the largest zoo you will have seen, but the entrance fee is only 4 euros and they still have rhinos:).

Sure this place is in a park, next to the children's playground and meant for families but as you come over the bridge it is not marked that you should take the first path in. So we passed it and had to return back. Then we saw the path inside is pebbly so not good for our
Very nice parc for only 2€. A lot of animals. You are in the Citadelle area and you have a lovely promenade around.
Great little zoo with some pretty cool animals. Also it is free, so you can wander in and out as you will. Also around the park, which has lots of entertainment here as well.
Natural surroundings for the animals. All were well fed and conditions very good no nasty smells! Used to be free but now 4 Euros, worth it as it goes back into the Zoo.

This is a lovely little zoo considering the very low entry fee, with a somewhat surprisingly selection of animals. It was a lovely visit although on a hit day some of the animals and birds were in hiding. Please note there are no refreshments inside the zoo but there is a

Our guide book said this zoo was free but we had to pay €4 for each of us but our 2 year old was free. However we did not begrudge this cost as it was great value. For a small zoo it had a wide range of animals - big (zebras & rhinos) and small (frogs & snakes) as well as

Although small, this is a lovely zoo. The entry fee is minimal and definitely value for money. All the areas are labelled showing which animals/birds/reptiles are in there, with a little bit of information about them (some in English but mostly in French at present). All the
A nice small size zoo, with a new free flight bird enclosure and new species in the zoo. Loads of European wild animals as part of breeding programmes to ensure animal survival.

What a place. What a delight. There is no reason why you cannot walk to Parc Zoologique. A free attraction! Why every city doesn't have one of these, I do not know. Birds, monkeys, zebras, Rhinos. It's brilliant. A true must for all, adults and children alike. Well done Lille!
very little is free these days, so this was an unexpected pleasure - a very pleasant little zoo by Bois de Boulogne.
A nice walk, its great that its free to walk around and obviously popular with the locals for their Sunday afternoon walks :)
A nice way to spend an hour with the kids. Zebras, rhinos, monkeys are all here. A small amusement park is just outside too) payment required for the rides)
A perfect family day out to enjoy this great zoo! They have more collection of wonderful animals from around the world! Highly recommended!

It is a nice surprise to stumble across a free zoo and I do not mean to sound ungrateful but it is not a very good one. Fun for families with small children (and there are a lot of children everywhere), but not adults. It is quite small and boring, the animals do not seem to

Free, moderate in size, this is worth a stroll around for an hour or so if you are in Lille more than a few days. Good variety of animals, most look pretty happy although a few enclosures might be a little on the small side for some people.
As it's free it is a nice asset to the city. Unfortunately it is closed during the winter months. Could do with some signs to indicate where zoo entrance is located.

I was visiting Lille by myself, and was looking at attractions to visit when I stumbled across this online! I was pleasantly surprised and decided to give it a visit. It was quite a distance from the station to work, definitely one for using maps on my phone! It was situated in

Considering this attraction is free, how can you complain! Some of the animal enclosures are a little small, but the larger animal enclosures are big enough for them to have a nice run, are clean and appear well maintained. Well worth a visit when having a walk in the park - you
Nice zoo, it's free but you have quite some exotic animals. The parc is not so big but you can see the animals very well and get close to them
This is a very small zoo, but it's free! So take your children and enjoy the animals and the green environment.

Really strange to find a mid range zoo, very close to the centre, that is free. Great for a walk out, brilliant for kids as there's a big play park near the entrance as well. For a family in Lille who have the time, a great place to go. Did I mention it's free?!

Considering this is free the zoo is worth a quick visit if walking around the area anyway. Situated in a beautiful park, the zoo itself is very small (there are a few birds, monkeys and llamas) but the park / forest around it makes up for it.
Great little zoo. Lots of birds and small animals. Especially enjoyed seeing the huge tortoises. Rhinos were away but back shortly hopefully. I nice couple of hours in a beautiful city

A Sunday in Lille when most things are closed, how on earth do you enertain a 4 year old? We miraculously stumbled upon this zoo..... This FREE zoo! It is very well maintained and all the animals (inluding Rhino and Zebra) look well looked after. Outside of the zoo there is a
What a fantastic idea a free zoo in the city. We had a lovely morning walk round here. The only thing I would say is they should make were to give donations more obvious.

First off, this is free. No charge at all. It is not the largest zoo you will ever visit but it is an enjoyable way to pass a few hours when in Lille. Some of the enclosures seem a little small but I suppose they meet accepted standards. For the size, and the cost of entry (I.e.
Stumbled across this on a visit to the citadel. A lovely little collection of animals and no entrance charge. Nice way to spend an hour.

It is free! Few animals - the orang utans were rather noisy. There seemed to be more parrots rather than animals in this zoo. Nice to walk around, if you have time to kill. Check out the nearby park too.

We had read the good reviews of this destination and my family and I had a great time. It is very well set out by type of animal and the facities are very clean and the animals seem ed to enjoy themselves. The monkies were hilarious. It is about a 15 walk from the Grand Place
Free zoo on the edge of main area. Not lots of animals, but they're well looked after and all seemed to be happy and not in distress.
This was a good little zoo especially as free, reptiles, monkeys, zebras, rhino and others. Nice feel to place.

While walking around the Citadel we diverted into this great little zoo. Not on our agenda for the day but we were very pleased that we did. And its was FREE entry. Please give a donation though, we all know how much it costs to visit any attraction and it all has to be paid for
This is a very nice zoo, my friend and I really enjoyed walking around looking at the animals under the shelter of lots of beautiful greenery
A nice and unexpactable place with quite exotic species in a relaxant environment. It also surprises with the free entrace!
I so love this zoo. A lovely collection of animals and birds who all seem to be accomodated in ultra clean, spacious environments. A very very very nice place to visit. HIGHLY recommended.
Quite small with a limited selection of animals, this zoo is probably best suited for an afternoon out with young children.
Animals look content and have good space to move around, small zoo but plenty of interesting things to see.

This was bigger than I thought it would be with a good variety of animals. It is nicely laid out and you do not feel that it is crowded, and the animals seem to be well cared for. On a very hot day for Lille (34+) though some were obviously having a great time, whilst others

Had an enjoyable time meandering through the zoo. It's small enough to cover easily with young children. Closed on a Tuesday though. There's a good park just next to the zoo too so easy to while away a whole day.
A really nice clean little zoo! My family thoroughly enjoyed our time there. We took a picnic and enjoyed it in the park before the zoo. It was a cheap fun way to spend an afternoon in Lille.

A good variety of animals including zebra, hippos, snakes , giant tortoise, birds - best of all, it was free! It's not huge but was a lovely end to our day in Lille at the park which is literally next door! Glad we found it.

Don't go on a Tuesday - zoo closed, car park closed - utter chaos. Came back the next day and enjoyed a lovely afternoon. It is a lovely stroll through mature woodland with some exotic animals thrown in. First some colourful bird - I call them all parrots, then some excitement

This zoo is fantastic and unbelievably free! In the UK would would spend about £35 for this as a family! It is really clean and a great way to spend a couple of hours. There is a kiosk near entrance where you can get burgers fries etc which wasn't great but acceptable. Don't be
Watch out for the Pokemon Go addicts. Pleasant little zoo that if I was a parent in Lille I would be taking my children there all the time.

We visited Lille without our kids and went to check out the citadel, but went to the entrance of the zoo to check for the prices. We were happily surprised to see that it was for free. So it was absolutely marvelous. Rhinocéros, zebras, several monkeys, parrots, red panda, ...
Spent a good afternoon. ...pack a picnic! Lots of animals to see! Quaint, well kept, clean little zoo!

Set in the confines of the impressive Citadel Fort, Parc Zoologique is a great find that should be the top of visitors things to do in Lille. Like many other people, I stumbled upon it by accident while exploring the park. Furthermore, I was pleasantly surprised to find out that
A zoo that's free. What else is there to say. Not only free but lots to do and see. Activities for kids just outside. Loads of animals and birds to see. And just near to the citadelle for walking.

We came across this Zoo by accident, as in area starting to walk to Citadel then noticed a small theme park then saw sign for zoo, as we entered we wondered where you pay.......well i do come from england where you pay for everthing.........but it was FREE, so at first thought

Extremely small zoo, very tiny. The zoo has only a few animals caged in here. The Gibbons are very active and always having fun with each other. There are a few species of mammals and birds. If you have nothing going on for a couple of hours is worth the trip. The best part is
Small, free and very well-organised. Little zoo near to city centre, you can spend about 1 hour. Bring your water...
The Zoo is not very big, but well kept. It is a fun afternoon expierence. The park surrounding the zoo is very nice.

I've visited this zoological garden several times and I liked it. There are all sorts of animals, birds and many species that people may have never seen in real life. I am happy to have discovered the red panda that is so sweet and always sleepy! I also saw a lot of amazing

In the heart of Lille it was refreshing to find an attraction suitable for families that is free! Parc zoologique is a small, but surprisingly good zoo, offering a fun morning's entertainment. I visited the zoo at probably its busiest time but still got a good view of the

Lovely little zoo - close to Lille Centre, in fact about a 20 minute gentle stroll. FREE to enter, and, although smallish has a lovely display of animals kept in clean and well maintained enclosures. Definitely worth a visit on a sunny day

This is a small zoo but delightful. All the animals are kept in large paddocks and the park is kept clean with flowered borders and hedges. The zoo has a free entrance and there is a café at the entrance. Very relaxing.

Set in an extensive park in the centre of Lille this is a good place to relax. An old style zoo rather than a safari park it is easy to walk around with plenty of places to stop and rest, or even have a picnic as I did with my son. Free to enter you have nothing to spend on but

Was closed on the day we tried to visit, despite checking website on the day. Lots of other disappointed people as well. A long way to go from our hotel to find out it was closed. Very disappointed children.
It's next to the Citadel, so if you went there for a walk, it's worth stopping at the Zoo. It's free, it's small, it's clean and it's a fun visit.

Found this by accident whilst strolling around Lille on a lazy Sunday am. Very relaxed atmosphere, very well looked after and above all free! Not the biggest zoo but a useful way of spending a couple of free hours,

This zoo was a bit random but it's very well kept and it's free! Has a really diverse range of animals - the red panda is a must-see! Would recommend, especially on a sunny afternoon. It's not just for the kids.

I love a zoo whenever I go somewhere as I know it will be a good way to pass the time. Lille zoo is, I would say, small to medium sized and doesn't have big attractions like tigers or elephants but it is good considering there is no entrance charge. It is also very central in
The zoo is on the small side but they did a really good job making the most of it. Highly recommended if you have a bit of time around the Citadel

The zoo is a short walk from the city centre. It is free - wow! It is next to a children's fairground in which the rides are not free. It has some well-designed enclosures, with a variety of animals and birds. You walk round on good paths and can do the whole zoo in 1-2 hours.

Whenever you are in Lille it is worth checking out the free zoo. It doesn't boast quite the range of large beasts you might get in other places but there is plenty to look at and enough to keep children amused for a couple of hours. Just next door there is also a childrens fun
Loved it. My son even found his father. It is not too busy either with clear views of all exhibits. I will bring the rest of my family.

We hired some bikes and cycled to the Citadel with the Zoo and a picnic in mind. A few too many schoolchildren for our liking as we are middle aged and intolerant 😃 but what a beautifully kept place, well worth spending a hour.
This is free to visit and absolutely fantastic for all ages. Beautifully kept and extremely clean. Loved it.

Even though it was a drizzly day, it did not take away the enjoyment of visiting these zoological gardens in Lille. It is totally free to enter and all the animals, birds, mammals, reptiles etc looked happy and in good condition. There were plenty of people around, including

We wandered around the free zoo in the sun, fantastically well looked after animals and birds, clean cages. Beautiful surroundings, stunning zebras and white rhinos. Amazing dark house with great variety of snakes and lizards etc. Would definitely recommend if you came with
Just got there because it's 1. Free 2. Nice and green 3. Only 10-15 minutes walk from center and 4. It is small but has exceptional animals... If you have time visiting lille don't miss it.
It's not the biggest nor the best, still it's a nice place and free... It has been improved these Last years, all Armand is Vauban fortification, annoter must see when coming in Lille

Located close to our hotel we went in on our last morning to while away a couple of hours and were most charmed by the wide variety of animals on show. Grooming pelicans, a cross porcupine, a couple of rhinos having a stand off followed by a joint wallow in the mud, indoors
If you have a family, the zoo is just a perfect place to spend an hour; the animals look content and the structures are in pristine condition.

It is a very small zoo, and during the weekend, if the weather is nice, it gets really crowded. But if you have kids, it is a nice way to spend a couple of hours (go in the morning!) , they will be happy. You have to appreciate that the city doesn't charge a fee for it, and
Very family-friendly zoo, free of charge. Although not so big, quite nice variety of animals can be found there.
We went on a Public Holiday so there were many families and lots of children. It was near our hotel so we went but I'm not a great fan of small animals in cages and I thought it was all a bit shabby.

Free parking, free zoo entry and some of the most beautiful animals in a stunning natural setting. Your little ones will absolutely love it, with the little funfair and parks to round off the afternoon in the shady woods next door.

To be honest, I have no idea how a zoo like this runs for free, but it is awesome. The place is actually quite large, and contains a range of different creatures: owls, iguana, various monkeys and birds, a snake, porcupine, meerkat, zebra, rhino...but I think the red panda was
Came across this by accident when we went exploring. Lovely to wander round in a bit of green space in the city and see the animals.

This Is a lovely way to wile away an hour or so on a sunny day. As a free attraction well worth a visit especially if you have children as a huge play park. Not that many animals but well laid out and beautiful park around it.

Situated in the park by the canal a fully occupied zoo of animals which is FREE to all who wish to visit It is about 15 minutes walk from Grand Place and the surrounding park is an ideal place for children to spend time and for picnicking.
The zoo is small, but has a lot of animals. Around the zoo is a nice park. We've been at the zoo on a sunday with nice weather. A lot of people visited the zoo, but we've saw all the animals.

Found this to be very close to our hotel. Small size of zoo with limited to birds and small mammals at entry. South American and Africa regions had very limited number of animals but they had decent enclosures. Monkeys were on islands in large ponds. Good place to just relax

Zoo with no entrance fee and tastefully located in a very nice greenish area. I have spent wonderful time with my little children. It's not immense so it's ideal for an afternoon stroll and picnic. Highly recommended for a relaxed family visit

Great zoo, they just added tasmanian devils to their collection. You can spend extra money and go behind the scenes to see how their routine is with the animals. While you are there, you should also consider taking a stroll at the Citadelle
Excellent way to pass an hour or two walk the circuit un-rushed with great views of the exhibits and informative staff

Amazed to find it free, it's beautifully kept and the animals well cared for. We watched keepers feeding and cleaning. Obviously a conservation Animal Park. We were very impressed and left a donation.
Every time I go to Lille I stop by the zoo to have a walk with my family or some friends. It is a lovely place to visit on a Sunday afternoon for example and it's free!
Unbelievably this little zoo has free entry. On Sunday morning in spring it was full of families with young children. Lots to see including rhinos and chimps. Cafe could have been more alluring.

What a lovely free attraction. We spent a very enjoyable couple of hours here, but BEWARE pickpockets operate near the entrance where it is crowded. Two women tried to steal from me but fortunately my husband was carrying our cash. Otherwise highly recommend a visit.
Amazing zoo but not so little and FREE!! The animals are so sweet and well cared for. You could easily spend half a day here. The monkeys are so frivolous and amusing.

What a wonderful small zoo we came across on our visit to Lille. We were astonished to find it was free to go in. Although it is small we spent two hours wandering around and being entertained by monkeys playing. There are rhinos, zebras and a variety of small animals and a
Even though its a small zoo its worth visiting and i find it to be one of the best attributes of the city. It's a hidden gem in Lille

What a wonderful surprise this zoo is. It is situated within the Citadel Park and most importantly entrance to the zoo is free. We liked it a lot and visited twice during our stay, making sure to give a donation on our way out. The animals all looked well cared for and the
Decided to pop in as passing. Great mix of large and small animals in well planned in closures. I am no expert but no paving animals in sight. Best of all FREE.

Nice stroll around the park, good little zoo, seen some species I have never seen before. Great for kids as there is a playground next to zoo, all for free. During school holidays there is a fun fair as well.

This small city zoo is located at champs des mars, about fifteen minutes walking distance from la grande place. It's an excellent outing for a city trip with kids. It's small, but entertaining and educational, moreover you still have time to do other things too. And. It's
Nice small zoo, but in March most animals seem to be in hiding. Since it is free, not bad for something to do with the kids.

This zoo surprised me I loved visiting all the animals. The red panda was so adorable and the white owl! The staff are friendly and the animals have nice enclosures. I also enjoyed watching the monkeys play I could watch them for hours! Happy day! 😊

I heard that Lille had a small zoo and went there only because I had a spare couple of hours to kill. What a gem, its much bigger than you think, they have a huge collection of animals, the white handed monkeys never stopped howling and it was a very enjoyable visit.On top of
The monkeys sound so loud but so cool was a bit depressing how small the poor animals werliving ! The red panda was just so sweet !
Lovely seeing all these beast with the sun out on a nice hot day Nice canteen onsite, have to visit the Rhino, that's a must. The Meercats are cheeky little sods, so they are a must see also
I would definitely recommend a walk around this place. It is free but you can (and should) leave a donation. It is not a huge zoo but has a large range of wildlife.
The zoo is small but very well kept. It's right in the middle of the city so accessing it is very easy. Good for an hour or two.

A 10-15 minute walk from the Grand Place will take you to the Parc Zoologique. There's free entry and it was really quiet when we visited - just after they opened on a Saturday morning. It's quite small but the have Rhino's, giant tortoise, Zebra, snakes and some exotic birds
Not a big place but tidy, smart and free. Easy access for all and enough to entertain the children for a morning

A fairly small little zoo, but with some really interesting animals and what looks to be very good facilities for the animals in question. Particular star of the show is the red panda, but all around a good fun afternoon out. Come here every time we visit the city and I dare say
nice and free. you can walk here from the town center (like 20 minutes on foot) and visit also the cittadelle

It is quite difficult to visit a public attraction when it closes annually for effectively two-thirds of the winter. A number of things are closed in Lille on Sunday so you'd expect something like the zoo to be open. The official website also has conflicting information with

We were a little gutted that the zoo was closed NYE and Day . Lots of families clearly thought it would be open also but there was no sign up to say why and the notice board implied it should be open but there were just locked gates and sad looking children

This little zoo, situated a short distance from Lille centre, is a must. It may be smaller than many but it's free. That's unique nowadays. There are a fair number of animals and birds on show and the baboons were really funny and entertaining, so much so that we went back the

Well this was a unexpectedly fun hour or so, it's not huge but it is free and there are a good range of animals to see. The atmosphere is relaxed and friendly. It is a short walk from the centre. The help information is good to support the exhibits. This was suggested by
A beautiful zoo that I visited with my kids. The animals are in very good shape. It have been à very pleasant visit.
Putting aside the weather we had it was a great day out and well worth seeing. I would recommend this place to families.

Nice and free zoo, perfect for a stroll during a nice sunny day. What else could you ask for? There's heap to visit in Lille, but with kids, that s a good alternative to the in town visits and museum visits.
Great for a Sunday where lots is not opened. Parking is free, admission is free and there are lots of animals on view. The meerkats and rhinos were brilliant.
It is free zoo only a short walk from the city centre. There is much to do for the children, and there is a great park next door. Worth a visit

Fantastic place to spend up to 2 hours close to Dunkirk ferry port. 2 adults and 1 child was 9 Euros unlike the U.K. over priced places. If you want to see big animals this is the wrong place for you. We were lucky enough to go into the nesting area of the beavers along with one

Admission is free. The place is not big, but is very clean, including the toilets. It is located in one of the most beautiful areas of the city. Very good option to take a walk and relax. You can also rent a bike to take a ride in the area outside the zoo (Citadelle de Lille).

We found this place when walking around the citadel, and to our surprise it was: A) massive B) free C) highly enjoyable It was a nice little place for a walk, with some informative signs... If you can speak French :)
This zoo is free entrance. The variety of animals is oke and it's a very clean accomodation. Because it's free, you will not see the great animals of a "real" zoo. Altough it's very nice!

I take my kids here often. Its a very nice and little Zoo and its free. in addition to the Zoo its on a very big park, so its ideal for walks or cycle rides, jogs. A big area for kids to play. You can spend an entire day(if they have the kids mini amusement park also open) or
This is FREE! Beautiful parkland with a zoo in the centre and the military castle. Great place to take the kids or a romantic walk without them

I had not intentionally planned to visit the zoo but on my visit to the Citadel I came across it. the good thing about it is that it's FREE!!! There are quite a few animals and birds to see and they seemed reasonably content. There was a lot to see so definitely worth checking
Free and apparently very well run zoo. Although it's on a modest scale it has lots of interesting animals. Definitely deserves a visite if visiting Lille.

We visited this zoo, it was free, and well run. All of the animals and birds seemed content and unstressed. The red tree bears (?) were great, and the indoor display with spiders and snakes suitably creepy. A good way to spend a couple of hours.
Well worth a visit. A small zoo with lots of interesting birds and small mammals along with rhinos and zebras. Very well kept and clean with informative signage.

This being free, we expected little more than a kids' petting zoo but although it's on a modest scale this facility boasts zebras, hippos and monkeys among its attractions. Very popular with the kids, it's in a park with children's amusements and picnic tables and is close to a

What a lovely find whilst away in Lille, A lovely small zoo in a beautiful park, the zoo will occupy you for a hr or so, it has a really lovely atmosphere , the animals seem happy and have plenty of space. You do not need a car as the transport system is excellent in Lille. A
Excellent small zoo. I can't believe the entrance is free ! A lovely way to spend a couple of hours. Would recommend with or without children .
Nice palce to spend hour or two just wandering around. Not loads of animals but what there is are well looked after, Its free entry so enjoy it and rest of park area,

Not loads of animals but those that are there are cared for and looked after very well. enclosures nice. and a pleasure to see the animals being the most important thing on the zoo keepers lists.........This is a free Zoo and could charge a little for people to get in and they
Great Zoo, has a really good selection of animals well looked after in spacious surroundings. There is no fee but worth a small donation.
When you have some free time you can always have a walk in the zoo. Nice place but not lots of animals. Given the fact that it's for free and suitable for kids. I give it a 5 Snakes area is lovely !

realy enjoyed the zoo some interesting animals ,monkeys, birds, Meercats ,and the roux panda bear was so cute , and set in the park with lots of places to picknic or buy from the restaurant /icecream stand ect
Not only was this a modern zoo with a variety of animals, but it was free! Not too far from the centre, definitely worth a visit.

we found this hard to find from the Rihour Metro its quite a walk. the zoo itself was clean and had small cages with birds and small mammals , and some Zebras in a compound it is set in a wooded area and a pleasant walk round . we were surprised to find that on a Tuesday with
Pleasantly surprised - monkeys, meerkats, turtles, owls.... To name a few. Well worth a visit even without children. Very good for families
good free zoo to kill an hour in, don't expect a major tourist attraction zoo, just a little quaint surprise in the citadelle

This is a small free zoo very close to the centre of Lille. There are not many animals, but it is set within nice grounds and surrounded by a nice play park for kids to go to when you have (quickly) completed your zoo visit. The walk to the nearest Metro and centre of town is
lovely little Zoo worth a visit as its FREE! We spent a long time watching the gibbons who were great fun.

This zoo is aimed at kids who want to see animals, while this is fine in itself, we were swamped with strollers and parents who let their children roam free, which is really annoying. There are three 'areas', one with monkeys and birds, one with rhino's and other animals, and

Zoo could be stretching it a bit with the main attractions being 2 rhinos and not much more big wild life apart from a few zebras a few monkeys a couple of hogs and cages of birds a couple of giant tortoise , set out to stay at a stretch a couple of hours tops . Worth seeing but

I have been to bigger zoos and maybe some of the enclosures could be a bit better but for a free activity it is nice for an hour or two. There is not so much written in English but how many attractions in the UK have multi-lingual information - not so many in my experience and

A small zoo /free entry / a bit like Noah's ark two of this two of that , though mainly birds / the zoo is in the middle of a park which is very popular with the locals on a warm Saturday afternoon when we went it was very busy . Easy walk from the town centre .
We were not planning to go to the zoo, but on our way to the citadel we found out it was free of charge. Nice for a change

This zoo is free and therefore we were not expecting too much, but we were surprised as actually the zoo is well kept and lots of different animals could be seen. It's a bit of a walk from the city center but worth it as you can spend few hours wondering around and check each

The park is free to visit, which is great. The animals don't seem to have too much space to move around in, (or maybe other zoos we have visited have more) There isn't as many animals as they have advertised, but still quite good as it's free.
It's free, what can you say... It's amazing that they still have big wildlife like elephants and zebra's without the entrance fee. Nice for an hour walkaround in a green environment.

Amazingly delightful and free! We had a fun couple of hours strolling around the zoo and enjoying the antics and the sights. It was busy (school holidays) but not over-crowded. Thumbs up to Lille for providing a facility like this.
It's a small little zoo. I found it entertaining even if we visited in the morning and it was very noisy because it was full of schoolchildren.

I'm not a huge fan of captive animal exhibits but this is a well thought out small zoo with good sized enclosures and habitats for most of the animals. Most generous of the city of Lille to offer this as a free attraction which in my experience is unheard of. Good on you.

The zoo is not that big but cages seems suitable for the animals inside, some animals, like monkeys, are not even in a cage but on an open-air island. You don't have a bad feeling when looking at them. A big part of them has even been captured in the city of Lille itself, lost

It was initially a nice surprise to come across in Lille. However, There was seemed to be nobody around looking after the animals. The Rhino and Zebra enclosure was shockingly small. The Pelicans kept trying to get out bite the wire fence to get out. They had to share the small
Very surprised to see a zoo of this size for FREE. Right alongside a children's parc, and rides that are open Wednesday and weekends. What a great find and a way to occupy the kids.

Well, firstly it's free, which is amazing!! Whilst we were a group of 5 adults and no children with us, I am a grandmother and therefore I know for certain my 5 year old granddaughter would absolutely love this. Walking towards the entrance of the Zoo you have a mini railway

A great little zoo on the outskirts of the city within walking distance from the city center. Well worth a visit for families, couples and solo travellers alike and can be done within a morning or an afternoon.

We tried to visit this Zoo in 2014. Unfortunately the Tour de France put paid to that as we chose the day it visited Lille 😒. Not to be put off we decided to visit today. I had heard it was free, though the car parking for three hours was €2. Not enough to put me off 😃 For
Absolutely fantastic zoo and it is free of charge to enter. The stalls are all clean and tidy and the animals are all healthy and well cared for.

We spent an afternoon at the zoo, the nearby amusement park and the old citadel fortifications. The zoo is worth a visit, it's rather small but beautifully laid out. With (young) children, you can spend about 2 hours and then finish with the amusement park and playground next

Was amazed to come across this free zoo, which has a small but select number of animals - loved the red panda who wandered around near us - bonus! Spotlessly clean, well cared for animals, small enough to go round in about an hour and a half and worth it.

first time i went was amazed that there was all this on offer for free! a very good zoo...however if its a sunday afternoon and hot maybe do something else as the rest of lille will also be visoting the zoo!

Considering it was free, the zoo was marvellous and worth a trip, with or without children! We went without. It was very busy with school children and under 5's too but it did not affect our enjoyment.

We actually stumbled apon this zoo whilst exploring around Lille. I love animals but I'm not keen on zoos in the UK as I have experienced not cruelty but a sense of "sadness" from the animals (I know that seems silly, but I' sure other animal lovers will get my drift!). I was

Beautiful small zoo near to Vauban Citadel in Lille. This zoo has free admission and is a well laid out zoo. A perfect place to have a leisurely stroll around or take children to. Well worth a visit or two

You must come here. It's walking distance from the centre and most importantly it's free. It's really well maintained and the variety of animals is amazing - rhinos, monkeys, zebras, meerkats etc. The day we went there were about 1000 school children but it was fine. Plenty of

Free zoo in the outskirts of the centre of Lille but only a 30 minute walk from the centre. We were pleasantly surprised by the variety of animals to see at the Zoo considering it is free entry. After finishing at the zoo, if you have young kids, there is a playground just
This was a very good Quality free Zoo ,you dont see many of those. Well worth a visit and we are not even Zoo people.
It was closed and the surrounding area was closed too. Felt very creepy like a closed down derelict fair ground! Very confusing as it said it was open!

This is up there with the best zoos I've been to in the world. Two giant rhinos residing in Lille? Who knew? And a great selection of other rare animals too. A great way to while away a morning or afternoon. Could desperately do with a cafe though!
Lovely play area for kids, small interesting zoo, and great park, plenty of parking, no toilets, that is a shame, two nice cafes

This is the only free zoo I have ever visited, but it is delightful and very much worth the visit. Largest animals are rhinoceros and Zebra, some monkeys on islands within the zoo, and a variety of other small mammals and birds. Extremely clean and tidy, and within walking
Stumbled Across this really lovely zoo whilst on a walk. Good variety of animals in a tranquil setting. Clean and pleasant

This zoo is relatively small, but the diversity of the animals and their health is extraordinary for a zoo that is free if charge. Plus it's in the citadel of Lille that you must visit anyway in case you are in the city. So, don't miss the zoo once you are in Lille (you can do

We were walking to the Citadel and came across the zoo! all four of us really enjoyed the experience and we are all over 55! It's not large... but very well set out, and clearly a lot of it has recently been redone. It was lovely to see all the apes having a great time

The zoo had an interesting array of animals, including rhinos, monkeys and meerkats. The zoo has been recently renovated, so everything looked in great condition and well looked after. The animals also looked as though they were being kept in good condition, which is always a
Fantastic FREE attraction with a range of animals. Not huge but what do you expect for free entry? Great kids area surrounding also. Not far to walk from main centre of Lille

Found by accident Parking 2€ for 3 hours or 4€ for the full day Very pleasant visit Great range of animals including ones we haven't seen in England or Scotland zoos Seen saw staff cleaning the enclosures which is also a rarity

We hadn't planned to visit the zoo and whilst walking around the citadel ended up going in, mainly because it was free. Not sure if it will always be free, but worth paying for if they charge, great for small children, the zoo isn't huge which makes it good for children as they

A great place to visit, really enjoyed watching the Red Pandas. I wasn't expecting it to be free, so it was a pleasant surprise. A downpour meant it was a fairly quick visit, we would have happily spent longer wandering around if it hadn't have rained.
Closest I've ever been to Red Pandas, one of my favourite animals. It's pretty small but very well presented and excellent value for money.

We planned this in our visit as you don't get many FREE zoo's. It was closed for refurbishment but was open the day we leave to come home so headed there first thing. We would have been happy to pay for the visit, you can tell it has had a major overhaul as everything is new.

A stroll out of the the city center in the direction of the Vauban's fortifications brang me to the cute small zoo where I enjoyed watching the monkeys on their island, the brightly coloured birds in their cages, and some exotic mammals. A nice break in my cultural trip.
Zoo was closed whilst we was there so just had a little stroll around the park - was a nice little stroll - would be a lot more to review on if the zoo etc had been open.

The Zoo has free entry and is a very pleasant place to visit. Plenty of animals etc and their surroundings in the enclosures looked like they were well looked after. The park itself is very nice with some very pleasant walks.
This place is huge and well maintained, you can definitely spend half a day here. I'm a photographer by hobby, So it's a treat for me.

This zoo in Lille is closed at the moment unfortunately, however from various points on the outskirts, the public can see the animals, such as the zebras, rhinos, monkeys, pelicans and red pandas. As the zoo is free, the staff don't seem to mind you climbing the small hill
Not too large, easy to find way around and you get to see a lot of animals and birds quite close. Near to river for a nice walk too. One of my favourite zoos and of course it is FREE entry
A very lovely little zoo which is very professionally maintained. It is free to visit and being compact is convenient for young children.

Nowadays it is not easy to do fun things for free, amusement parks, movies, etc, became pretty expensive, if you're a broke student or a family with kids, you have other priorities. But in Lille, you can visit the zoo for free! Yes! See red pandas, rhinoceros, zebras, alpaca,
Great way to spend a fine day. Loads to see, excellent services, baby changing etc., near to centre of Lille.

Despite its somewhat small size, this free zoo near the citadel in Lille, France was a good way to spend a couple hours with our kids. We visited Lille over Thanksgiving and hit the zoo at the afternoon feeding time. Al the animals were active and looked well cared for. The

The fact this zoo is free means it's great for a day out with family and friends. Only problem is it closes during Winter months

Small zoo located by the Citadel. We visited in mid December and naturally several of the tropical animals were keeping warm indoors. There was also some renovation work taking place. Well worth a visit if you are nearby especially considering it's free.
A small zoo situated on the outskirts of the citadel. Entrance is free - added bonus. There are a variety of animals ranging from birds to meerkats, giant turtles to rhinos.

The zoo is free which is brilliant but it is closed between December and May 1st. There are quite a few animals including rhinos, zebra and giant tortoises. Well worth a visit for free if you're there at the right time.

Free entrance, that's the best thing to mention. Can't be compared with other zoos I've already visited, where you have to pay. Worth the visit, you've seen al the animals in 45 minutes. Nice walk in combination with a walk around the Citadel...

Amazing little zoo tucked away by the citadel. Staff were friendly and approachable. Not the largest zoo but the animals were well kept after and attended too. I saw Zebras, meerkats and an array of birds.
Lovely little zoo free entry so can be combined with a walk around the citadel all the animals looked well cared for nothing to dislike a well spent hour.

A great little zoo, inside the walls of the Citadel. Some really great animals too: rhino, zebra, mouse deer. Much better than many zoos that charge an entry price. Fantastic entertainment for the family - especially for free.

just been, can not complain, its a very good zoo for something that is free, the rhino and zebra enclosures were empty but there was a sign explaining and I gather that this was either the time of year or maintenance work, this did not take away anything from the experience, the

The zoo has a good mix of animals including a cool tropical house with various serpents. The top attraction are the rhinos. It's nicely located close to a playground and a small game park so perfect for a family outing.
Love the zoo and park for kids to play in. The citadel is great fir walks or running. Even the little fun fair isnt too pricey. Little ones love it.

Really surprised by how good this was , considering it is free entry ! Lots to see for young children and a good range of animals. Also great location as you can easily walk from Lille City Centre. Beware, however, it is not very well signposted so we ended up walking for miles

Right inside the Citadel is the most adorable little FREE zoo. My husband and I enjoyed an hour-long visit on a Saturday morning when it seems the animals were just getting into the swing of things. Lots of raptors, 2 red pandas, monkeys, rhinos, and an indoor tropical exhibit

For a free zoo I thought this was pretty good. They have a range of animals, ranging from zebra, birds, monkeys and rhinos. The zoo is not huge, but its a nice trip. I went on a Sunday when most things are closed, so was a good as gives you something to do.
What more could you ask for. Loads of animals all kept in large cages or spaces for them move about. All very clean and well cared for. Superb little tots fun fair close by and a good cheap cafe too.

We took our Daughters here for a couple of hours in the afternoon and found it excellent for a short visit. We couldn't believe that it was free, we normally pay huge entrance fees in the UK! The zoo was small but had some beautiful animals to observe, my Daughters favourite was
Not bad for a free zoo. A few large african animals (rhino). OK for passing an hour. Easy to walk around. Outside cafe/bar close by.
its free and the kids are involved by the parc attendants too participate in Learning something about the animals.
Animals all healthy and happy. Good for kids and parents of which we are neither but we still enjoyed it
Liked this zoo so much we went twice! Nice to see animals in near natural settings. Nice place to eat lunch outside.

I went on a Monday morning at 10 - wonderfully quiet and conducive to a good bit of photography! The zoo also seem to have a spooky ability to make groups of schoolchildren disappear - I saw a couple of groups appear and despite the zoo being very compact with no indoor areas,
You don't get much for free, so when visiting the Citadel take a stroll around the zoo. Birds, monkeys, zebras, reptiles, rhinos and many more
A very good family zoo. Didnt knew anything about it but i enjoyed it very much. I Adore the red panda and meercats.

Yes, the zoo is free of charge and it's a very calm and relaxing place to visit for a walk. It's captivating to watch the wide array of animals (mostly small to medium size). For that, I would say that this would be rated "very good." However, it's the twenty-first century and
Shady and quiet place with interesting mix of animals, who,all looked happy and well looked after. Can't believe that it is free of charge. Clean toilets too and snack food near entrance.

Fantastic place. Gibbons were so funny and looked to be having a lot of fun playing. Snakes were horrible - as you'd expect. My highlight were the two wonderful tortoise. They were massive Definitely worth a visit and I'm still baffled that it's free. One word of caution
We visited this zoo expecting a small childrens zoo , but we were highly delighted when we saw, zebras, rhinos, monkeys etc. Amazing that it was free of charge. Its a must when visiting Lille.
Lovely little zoo. Two enormous tortoises. Good sealion show. Flying display of owls, parrots and hawks excellent. Nice ice- cream.

It's a very nice zoo considering the free entry. There was a wide range of animals arranged in a very good way. I especially liked the tropic zone which is an independent building full of snakes tortoises and monkeys :) A very good way to spend your Sunday morning at Lille!
They were showing off the whole time and when ever people copied their noise it made them make more noise love them!
Surprised this was free, a good many animals. If you have choice avoid weekends when its very busy. No tea/coffee stop available nearby.
We stumbled across the zoo whilst taking a walk around the citadel - we didnt realise there was one here and it was FREE!! A wide range of animals to sit and watch.
Amazing to see the wide range of animals for free in the park. Much bigger than expected and really enjoyed it.
For a free park zoo this place is well worth a visit! Really good animals & was a nice surprise at how big it was!

Nice park and free zoo. Was a bit old looking. Most animals in good condition. Rhinos and zebras in large area. Take a picnic as cafe very busy and food limited. Bar and beer more of a priority, weird to see but common in lille. Good assortment of animals. Good for family with

The zoo in Lille is free, which is a bonus! A visit here as you explore the park surrounding the Citadel is definitely worth it! Enjoyed seeing all the animals and I really thought the zoo was nicely layed out! Was a great way to spend a morning! I recommend a visit here!

We went to this zoo before a day out in Lille and we were all really impressed. The animals are well Looked after, the zoo is clean and they even have rhinos! It's a shame they don't have a donations box as we would've put something in.. Definately worth a visit
We were shocked it was free. The grounds are nice with a wall and castle area. There is also a play park for younger children right next to zoo.
More of a zoo park than a zoo although they have two Rino anyway it is free. Great for children when we visited there was also a funfair nearby. Follow directions for the Citadel to locate.
Well cared for animals and lots of interesting information about them. All of them in settings which seemed appropriate for the creature.
The zoo is free and is situated in the Citadelle park that also is worth seeing. The zoo has a few animals, but is a nice walk around attached to seeing the Citadelle park.

visited the park and zoo with family. Enjoyed a relaxing and interesting walk around the park and zoo. Good range of different animals on view. Only concern was that some animal enclosures looked a bit dilapidated and some of the animal enclosures look a little small
An excellent zoo. Staff very helpful. The zoo was tidy and the animals seemed well cared for. It is free! Well worth a visit especially popular with children.
Free Zoo with good organisation. Spend a couple of hours here. Great location as well. We took a walk around the Citadell on the adjacent site.
A terrific find in Lille - a wonderful zoo with giant tortoises, rhinos, tapirs and gibbons with no entry fee. A lovely couple of hours seeing the animals and reading about the conservation efforts.
Whilst this is a small zoo, we really enjoyed our visit. The animals appeared to be very well looked after and good sized enclosures.

When I read that the zoo was free admittance I was slightly concerned that the living conditions for the animals would be bad. Fortunately, this was not the case at all and the zoo is an excellent, budget friendly way to kill time. I expect this would be terrific with kids.

The zoo is free. That's good, but it is lacking. The enclosures are well sized and the animals seem fairly happy but the premises, paved areas, and general design hasn't really been updated for the 1980s. All and all though we had an enjoyable day, and it was completely free.
This zoo is a great place to visit and is completely free! Good size enclosures and animals are grouped in categories. Very interesting and would cost a fortune to visit with a family in the UK.

this zoo is not the biggest but its free we spent about 2 hours walking round the numerous animals and birds. all were well looked after and you could get close up to them unlike zoos in u k. the gardens were well maintained and very clean. the paths were good for people of all
This zoo is not the best zoo but the park is nice and its free entrance. There's a great playground a little further up on the park too. Good stop of if your in lille.

This free attraction was far better than we had expected, numerous animals including Zebra and Rhinos and all for free entry!

A lovely little zoo, surprisingly free. The gibbons are very entertaining. Very popular with local families and schoolchildren. Well worth a visit. Go for a stroll in the park and round the Citadel at the same time.
A free zoo right in the centre of a lovely city was a fantastic surprise. Don't miss this on any trip to Lille.

Very near and on the way to the Citadel in a lovely park area you find this Free to visit Zoo, and although not very big it is clearly signposted around the grounds. Variety of animals including Zebras, rhino's Tapirs, meerkats, monkeys, wide variety of birds and good walks.

Its just not right that animals should be kept in such places. there are some big rhinos that should have been wondering free to fulfill there full potential. Most of the animals looked unhappy and listless.
Worth a visit. Free entry and gets quite busy. Part of the Citadelle park, which is also a great place to have a quiet walk. Route around the Citadelle is 1.8km.
Excellent small zoo with some amazing different animals and birds. No entry fee. Lovely way to relax and enjoy, so much work has been put in to this project, to be congratulated.

Well worth a visit - lovely enclosures for the animals and free entry. Close to the Citadel and can be packed with school parties sop choose your time wisely especially if you want to have some of the lovely french fries from the caravan at the entrance!

This venue is free and well situated within Lille for an amzing day out. The zoo-not huge, is well laid out and although busy, you never felt it was crowDed. A big plus is that it is FREE!

This is lovely place to come and unwind. This zoo is not massive but very interesting and great fun for kids and adults alike. You will find that they are sections named after countries of animals origins. The zoo was rather busy when we visited on Sunday but as you walk in one

We spent at least 2 hours here and could've stayed longer! An amazing range of animals, and it was all really week laid out. It must cost a lot to maintain so it is a surprise that it is free. Not too far to walk from the city centre.

A must for all visiting Lille ,we went for a walk in the park which was very enjoyable, we then came across the entrance to the Zoo ,we looked for a board for a entrance fee we couldn't believe it, it was free, as you leave the zoo there is a donation box on a stand ,i'm sure

if it cost $40 it would maybe be 3-4 star. But for free, it is in a beautiful park environment, lovely exhibits, my kids loved it, plenty of quirky things to see and active monkeys, rhinos, zebras, much more than expected.... and did I say free? Easy place to spend an hour or 2.

I really enjoyed the experience. They have the rhinos which was amazing to watch as they interact and were about to have a little domesic fight :) we also loved the monkies, and have seen many types of owels and birds. Your children will love it for sure.. it's a nice day out,
The zoo is free and there are some interesting animals there. If you go on a nice day during the weekend expect crowds.

Nice. It was on sunday...I don't know the reason, but it was free. I guess that because of the rain most of the animals were hiding so not the best zoo experience I had. Worth visiting though...I guess it's one of the most interesting places in such a boring city.

I love zoos so the fact that this one was free made it even more attractive. It's situated near the citadel and a park and has a great range of animals (considering it's a free zoo) and has plenty of kiosks selling food if you're hungry. I definitely recommend going for a look

lovely place to visit and spend a couple of hours at. our little man really enjoyed his time here. and where can you visit a zoo (albeit small) for free?
The zoo was a great morning out, get a good view of the animals on show. Its a small zoo but well worth a visit and its is free. If you enjoy it you can make a donation if you wish.

I was very scepitcal that this would really be a free zoo and expected an uplif for the lions etc, no uplift and also no lions. This is a very nice small park zoo, well laid out. The number of Zoo animals are limited focusing on birds and monkeys but there are a number of

Excellent afternoon outing. Well laid out park with interesting variety of animals! It's free and a welcome break from walking around in the town. There is a good café near the entrance, where they serve delicious chips with mayonnaise!
This is an excellent half-day excursion, with a variety of animals. Best of all, it's free! Would recommend taking your own snacks and drinks.
Yes, Lille zoo is quite free to visit, very well kept, and the animals all looked happy and healthy. Well worth the visit and a 15 minute wajk from the town Centre.

free zoo, not with a lot of big animals but very cosy and nice for littlle children. A rhino, several monkeys, a lot of birds, maki's, turtles, snakes...there is also a snackresto, little amusement park and huge playground nearby.

Loved this little zoo, they had very cute and interesting animals (especially the red pandas which I adored viewing from up close) and kept reasonably clean and nice considering it's free. Please donate on your way out to keep it free and pleasant for the animals!

It's small, but it's free and a good way to pass the time on a sunny day. The gorilla habitat is really interesting.You can watch them play freely from a safe distance.I liked it and recommend it to everyone - especially parents with small children.
It's small, but it's free and a good way to pass the time. I really liked it and would go again. If you go and like, please remember to put something in the donation box on the way out!
Small but interesting zoo within walking distance, definitely worth a visit. You can also walk through park and alongside the canal in this area particularly pleasant on a sunny day.

Easy to get around with a baby in a pram and a toddler walking. Plenty of animals. FREE!! Also, located next to a great park where our toddler was happily entertained for hours. Recommended.

I visited Lille for the day and made an effort to visit - and its an amazing place to see. The day I went was raining, and there wasn't many people there which had made it even more amaing as I could take my time and watch the animals for a while. There is a little fair next to

We spent a few hours there with our daughters. In spite of its being cold and misty, we enjoyed ourselves thoroughly. It is a small zoo but there were interesting animals we've not seen in American zoos. The animals were pretty active. We watched monkeys swinging and playing.
Zoo is good place to visit. When i visited, there was a fair and lot of shops. A lot of people come with their family to visit this place.

Very nice place to go on weekends and spend a nice day. There is a few animals that you can see and a park to rest. In the exit you can eat the best goffres, in a roullote, made by a very nice couple.

Monkey island, red pandas in treehouse platform on arrival, zebras, llamas and some (captive ergo dispirited) parrots.
Very busy on a warm Sunday afternoon, so not much chance to enjoy seeing the animals. Could do with more refreshment facilities inside of the park.

Great free attraction. We particularly enjoyed seeing the rhinos, alpacas and zebras! Animals seem really happy and well looked-after. There was also a fair, smoothie/ice cream/crepe stand, boat rides and a children's railway ride on the same site on the day we visited. A
The zoo is lovely, we had a very enjoyable couple of hours strolling around in the sun. The territory is quite big and most of the animals seem to have quite a lot of space.
its free and is wonderful for a sunday stroll the animals are looked after well thier did seem to be a lot of terapines

Lots of interesting animals to look at including red pandas when you enter and a great tropical house when the northern French weather gets a bit chilly to handle. Not that much information in English for non francophones but the zoo is good and the animals look well cared for.

Funny, they are quite relaxed re fences and stuff here. A bit different to the Aus Nanny State. A natural setting and a great afternoon.

nice to look around while yr there, no charge either! animals all looked healthy and well kept ,

not very big but animals seem happy the red pandas are really cute great value it's FREE

one of the best zoo's i have been to in all of my life especially so because its free. the many exhibits are fasinating and the different facts, animals and experiences are breathtaking. you cannot overstate this place with many animals from zebras to macaws to snakes. ever
